data.enText: explosion
data.chText: 爆炸

data.enText: an explosion or a powerful movement of air caused by an explosion
data.chText: 爆炸；（爆炸引起的）气浪，冲击波

data.enText: a bomb blast
data.chText: 炸弹爆炸

data.enText: 27 schoolchildren were injured in the blast.
data.chText: 27名学龄儿童在爆炸中受了伤。

data.enText: of air
data.chText: 空气

data.enText: a sudden strong movement of air
data.chText: 突如其来的强劲气流

data.enText: A blast of hot air hit us as we stepped off the plane.
data.chText: 我们下飞机时，一股热浪向我们袭来。

data.enText: the wind's icy blasts
data.chText: 凛冽的狂风

data.enText: loud noise
data.chText: 大声

data.enText: a sudden loud noise, especially one made by a musical instrument that you blow, or by a whistle or a car horn
data.chText: （吹奏乐器、哨子、汽车喇叭等突然发出的）响声，吹奏声，轰鸣

data.enText: three short blasts on the ship's siren
data.chText: 船上三次短促的汽笛声

data.enText: criticism
data.chText: 批评

data.enText: strong criticism
data.chText: 严厉的批评；激烈的抨击

data.enText: Blast for prison governors in judge's report
data.chText: 法官报告中对典狱长的猛烈抨击

data.enText: fun
data.chText: 欢乐

data.enText: a very enjoyable experience that is a lot of fun
data.chText: 热闹的聚会；狂欢

data.enText: The party was a blast.
data.chText: 聚会非常热闹。

data.enText: We had a blast at the party.
data.chText: 我们在聚会上玩得很开心。

data.enText: a blast from the past
a person or thing from your past that you see, hear, meet, etc. again in the present
data.chText: （现在又看见、听到、遇到等的）故人，往事，旧物

data.enText: (at) full blast
with the greatest possible volume or power
data.chText: 最大音量地；最大马力地

data.enText: She had the car stereo on at full blast.
data.chText: 她把汽车立体声音响开到了最大音量。

data.enText: explode
data.chText: 爆炸

data.enText: to violently destroy or break sth into pieces, using explosives
data.chText: （用炸药）炸毁，把…炸成碎片；爆破

data.enText: They blasted a huge crater in the runway.
data.chText: 他们在飞机跑道上炸了一个大坑。

data.enText: They had to blast a tunnel through the mountain.
data.chText: 他们得炸出一条穿山隧道。

data.enText: All the windows were blasted inwards with the force of the explosion.
data.chText: 爆炸的震动力把所有窗户都震碎到屋里。

data.enText: The jumbo jet was blasted out of the sky.
data.chText: 那架巨型喷气式飞机在空中被炸成碎片。

data.enText: Danger! Blasting in Progress!
data.chText: 危险！爆破进行中！

data.enText: make loud noise
data.chText: 发出高声

data.enText: to make a loud unpleasant noise, especially music
data.chText: 发出刺耳的高音，轰鸣（尤指音乐）

data.enText: Music suddenly blasted out from the speakers.
data.chText: 喇叭中突然响起了轰鸣的音乐。

data.enText: The radio blasted out rock music at full volume.
data.chText: 收音机以最大音量播放摇滚乐。

data.enText: criticize
data.chText: 批评

data.enText: to criticize sb/sth severely
data.chText: 严厉批评；猛烈抨击

data.enText: The movie was blasted by all the critics.
data.chText: 这部影片受到了所有评论家的严厉抨击。

data.enText: hit/kick
data.chText: 打；踢

data.enText: to hit or kick sb/sth with a lot of force
data.chText: 狠打；猛踢

data.enText: He blasted the ball past the goalie.
data.chText: 他飞脚将球踢过了守门员。

data.enText: He blasted the policeman right between the eyes.
data.chText: 他对着那个警察的鼻梁“𠳐”就是一拳。

data.enText: air/water
data.chText: 空气；水

data.enText: to direct air, water, etc. at sb/sth with a lot of force
data.chText: 向…猛吹；（用水）向…喷射

data.enText: Police blasted the demonstrators with water cannons.
data.chText: 警察用高压水炮喷射示威者。

data.enText: destroy with disease, etc.
data.chText: 使毁于疾病等

data.enText: to destroy sth such as a plant with disease, cold, heat, etc.
data.chText: 使（植物等）毁于疾病（或寒冷、酷热等）

data.enText: Their whole crop had been blasted by a late frost.
data.chText: 一场晚霜把他们的庄稼全毁了。

data.enText: blast away
if a gun or sb using a gun blasts away , the gun fires continuously and loudly
data.chText: 连续高声地射击

data.enText: blast off
to leave the ground
data.chText: 发射升空

data.enText: people sometimes say Blast! when they are annoyed about sth
data.chText: （恼怒时说）该死，倒霉

data.enText: Oh blast! The car won't start.
data.chText: 真该死！车子就是发动不了。

means: (吹奏乐器、哨子、汽车喇叭等突然发出的)响声，吹奏声，轰鸣
发出刺耳的高音，轰鸣(尤指音乐)
使（植物等）毁于疾病（或寒冷、酷热等）

ex.enText: A massive car bomb blasted the police headquarters.
ex.chText: 一枚威力巨大的汽车炸弹炸毁了警察总部。

ex.enText: The experts said it was impossible to blast a road out of solid rock.
ex.chText: 专家称从坚固的岩石中炸出一条路来是不可能的。

synonyms.bx: 通常指用炸弹、炮弹等造成破坏，或是为筑路等进行爆破。

ex.enText: The soldiers blew up the bridge.
They vowed that they would blow up the enemy's ship.

synonyms.bx: 通常指人炸毁建筑物、汽车等。

ex.enText: The little boy burst a balloon with a pin.
ex.chText: 那个小男孩用大头针把气球戳破了。

synonyms.bx: 指某物因内部或外部压力过大而突然破裂、爆裂、爆炸等。

ex.enText: Suddenly, the bomb exploded under the bridge.
ex.chText: 突然，炸弹在大桥下爆炸。

ex.enText: The bomber caused the railway station to explode.
ex.chText: 轰炸机投弹炸掉了火车站。

synonyms.bx: 指炸弹或其他爆炸物等爆炸，或表示将某物炸成碎片，通常伴有巨响及损毁。

data.enText: blast away
if a gun or sb using a gun blasts away , the gun fires continuously and loudly
data.chText: 连续高声地射击

data.enText: blast off
to leave the ground
data.chText: 发射升空

trans: （收音机等）发出巨响；（流行乐队）带来喧闹的乐声

data.enText: a blast from the past
a person or thing from your past that you see, hear, meet, etc. again in the present
data.chText: （现在又看见、听到、遇到等的）故人，往事，旧物

data.enText: (at) full blast
with the greatest possible volume or power
data.chText: 最大音量地；最大马力地

data.enText: She had the car stereo on at full blast.
data.chText: 她把汽车立体声音响开到了最大音量。

example: Clinton directed his fire at the Republican Party
the government has come under attack

tr: a highly pleasurable or exciting experience
example: we had a good time at the party
celebrating after the game was a blast
the tree was bent almost double by the gust

tr: shrivel or wither or mature imperfectly

example: The press savaged the new President
The critics crucified the author for plagiarizing a famous passage
The enemy has been shelling us all day

tr: make with or as if with an explosion
example: blast a tunnel through the Alps
blast a passage through the mountain

tr: apply a draft or strong wind to to
example: the air conditioning was blasting cold air at us
She tended to blast when speaking into a microphone

example.ex: 250 people were killed in the blast.
example.tran: 250人在这次爆炸中丧生。

value.def: A blast is a big explosion, especially one caused by a bomb.

example.ex: There is a risk that toxic chemicals might be blasted into the atmosphere.
example.tran: 爆炸后有毒化学物质可能会进入大气层。

example.ex: ...a terrible accident in which his  left arm was blasted off by some kind of a bomb...
example.tran: 他的左臂被某种炸弹炸飞的可怕事故

example.ex: Earlier two holes were blasted into the ship's  hull to let water out and stabilise the ferry...
example.tran: 之前在船体上炸出了两个洞，以便把水排出，使船平稳下来。

example.ex: The explosion which followed blasted out the external supporting wall of her flat.
example.tran: 接下来的爆炸毁坏了她公寓的外支撑墙。

gramarinfo.label: Also V n adj, V n prep

value.def: If something is blasted into a particular place or state, an explosion causes it to be in that place or state. If a hole is blasted in something, it is created by an explosion.

example.ex: Their work was taken up with boring and blasting rock with gelignite...
example.tran: 他们的工作是用葛里炸药炸石头，非常枯燥。

example.ex: They're  using dynamite to blast away rocks to put a road in.
example.tran: 他们用炸药炸石筑路。

value.def: If workers are blasting rock, they are using explosives to make holes in it or destroy it, for example so that a road or tunnel can be built.

example.ex: Three miles away there was a salvo of blasting in the quarry.
example.tran: 三英里之外的采石场进行了爆破作业。

example.ex: ...a son who blasted his father to death after a lifetime of bullying...
example.tran: 因从小到大一直被父亲虐待而开枪弑父的男子

example.ex: Alan Barnett, 28, was blasted with a sawn-off shotgun in Oldham on Thursday.
example.tran: 28岁的艾伦·巴尼特于星期四在奥德姆被人用短管猎枪射杀。

example.ex: ...the man who killed Nigel Davies with a shotgun blast.
example.tran: 用猎枪打死奈杰尔·戴维斯的男子

value.def: To blast someone means to shoot them with a gun.

example.ex: The police were reported to have blasted their way into the house using explosives...
example.tran: 据报道，警方借助爆破冲进了房子。

example.ex: One armoured column attempted to blast a path through a barricade of buses and trucks.
example.tran: 一个武装纵队试图从公交车和卡车组成的路障中间炸出一条通道来。

value.def: If someone blasts their way somewhere, they get there by shooting at people or causing an explosion.
value.tran: （通过枪击） 冲出（道路）；轰开，炸开（通路）

example.ex: Blasting cold air over it makes the water evaporate...
example.tran: 向它喷射冷空气可以使水蒸发。

example.ex: A blizzard was blasting great drifts of snow across the lake.
example.tran: 暴风雪夹着大团的积雪吹过湖面。

example.ex: Blasts of cold air swept down from the mountains.
example.tran: 强冷气流从山上疾掠而下。

value.def: Ifsomething blasts water or air somewhere, it sends out a sudden, powerful stream of it.

example.ex: ...drivers who do not blast their horns...
example.tran: 不按喇叭的司机

example.ex: The sound of western music blasted as she entered.
example.tran: 她一进门便听到西部音乐震天的响声。

example.ex: The buzzer suddenly responded in a long blast of sound.
example.tran: 蜂鸣器突然相应地发出了一声响亮的长鸣。

value.def: If you blast something such as a car horn, or if it blasts, it makes a sudden, loud sound. If something blasts music, or music blasts, the music is very loud.
value.tran: （使）（汽车喇叭等）突然发出响亮的声音；（使）（音乐）轰响

example.ex: Ramsay blasted the ball into the back of the net...
example.tran: 拉姆齐劲射入网。

example.ex: He may try to blast his way out of trouble, playing attacking shots to balls he would not normally contemplate hitting.
example.tran: 他可能是想努力摆脱困境，平时不会考虑击打的球也打起了进攻。

value.def: You can say that a sports player blasts the ball somewhere if he or she gives it a powerful kick or hit.

example.ex: Football: Taylor blasts Beck...
example.tran: 足球：泰勒炮轰贝克。

example.ex: The Department of Health and a top immunologist have blasted a report in last week's Sunday Times.
example.tran: 卫生部和一位知名免疫学家严词抨击了上周《星期日泰晤士报》的一篇报道。

example.ex: Cricket: Blast for Ormrod.
example.tran: 板球：炮轰奥姆罗德。

value.def: To blast someone or something means to criticize them strongly.

example.ex: Blast! I can't do anything with this.
example.tran: 真该死！我拿这个一点办法也没有。

value.def: Some people say 'blast' to show that they are annoyed at something or someone.

example.ex: Making the album was a real blast.
example.tran: 做这个专辑真是一种乐趣。

value.def: If you say that something was a blast, you mean that you enjoyed it very much.
value.tran: 有趣的事；开心的事；乐趣

example.ex: In many of those homes the television is on full blast 24 hours a day...
example.tran: 那些家庭有很多一天24小时把电视开到最大音量。

example.ex: You are unlikely to run the heater at full blast for long periods.
example.tran: 你不太可能长时间把加热器开到最大挡位。

value.def: If something such as a radio or a heater is on full blast, or at full blast, it is producing as much sound or power as it is able to.
value.tran: 以最大音量；以最大功率

value.def: You can use a blast from the past as a light-hearted way of referring to something such as an old song or fashion that you hear or notice again, and which reminds you of an earlier time.
value.tran: 岁月回响（勾起回忆的老歌、旧时尚等）
